column4: hmm.. my system just locked up, totally unresponsive. dunno what caused it (!)
perhaps there's something in /var/log/ after you reboot which gives you hints
sorry, fairly new to linux. There are some errors in syslog though (e.g. Device 'i823650' does not have a release() function, it is broken and must be fixed.
did you reboot in the meantime?
just rebooted 2 mins ago (had to use the reset button)
bottom of file? top of file?
towards, the bottom, but all the way at the bottom, all the messages from the last reboot will be
so go to the bottom, and back from there
how bout this? [fglrx:firegl_unlock]  *ERROR* Process 4666 using kernel context 0
well, if this is the last you see in the log (followed by something like 'Syslog restart') it is good enough to file a bug report
that error was after syslogd 1.4.1#14ubuntu4: restart.
hmm
well, with 'after' you mean 'further towards the end of the file', right?
yeah - I seem to get that error each boot, it maybe wasn't what locked the system?
one thing you could do is try to login via SSH, if you have access to a computer which is networked to your box
update-rc.d is the Debian way
how would I use update-rc.d to add a service to be started at boot?
there's an manpage, 'man update-rc.d'
rcconf might be easier, dunno
thanks
